answers.answer: Hello...if the cancer has metastisizedd to the bone I cannot imagine it would be localized enough to be able to have it surgically removed.  I know she must be really disappointed.....all she can do now is fight this monster again.....it is said by some here that this disease is chronic and will need to be dealt with sort of like diabetes.....not a pleasant thought but quite factual.  Her depression is quite understandable.....maybe an anti-depressant should be considered.  Every one of us is different when it comes to prognosis.....nobody knows how long anyone has...and, anyone who says they do know should be clobbered.  Your friend will want to talk at some point in time and it is good you are there for her and are not a member of her family.  She is lucky to have you to go through this with her.  It was hard for me to unload on my family as it was so hard for them to stand back and watch what was happening to me.  I wish only the best for you and her.....come back and talk anytime.....maybe your friend would like to visit with us as well.  TAke care and give your friend our best.Peace.dian

I can relate to what your friend is going through...my ovca spread to my brain which is extremely unusual.  Yet I have chosen to persevere and do what I have to do to stay alive.  Bless you for wanting to encourage her.  I, too, wish the both of you the best.Christa

question: My friend was diagnosised with stage 1 grade 3 oc 7 years ago.  At that time, she had 1 ovary and tube removed and received chemo and radiation.  Two years ago she developed oc to the other ovary, which they discovered when she realized she was pregnant.  She had hoped to make it full term, but after 5 months the mass was getting too large and they needed to remove it.  She again endured her rounds of chemo and radiation, but 6 months after the treatment ended, they have now found mets to her hip bone.  I'm hurt for her and her children and family and have been trying to find info on ovarian cancer and mets to bone, but have found it rare and not much info on the subject.  Can you tell me what to expect/prognosis with this new mets?  She is very depressed and trying not to think of it, so I do not want to force talk that she can't handle right now...all Im aware of is they are doing more chemo and radiation...is surgery not possible?
title: bone mets from recurrent ovarian cancer
